channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @SapioSiren @swordsjew It warms my boomer heart to see young folk who still know Perl (not that I ever mastered it at this level).

@hardmaru So I play a lot with the text generator at https://t.co/OdngmloMv0 and it’s a very strange thing. Fictional stories that read like news articles and reflect an enormous range of knowledge only partially remembered. The AI is very knowledgeable but only somewhat smart. Or drunk.
@hardmaru But I hesitate to post the results online because it has real people saying things in their fields of expertise that are of course not true.
@hardmaru I wonder how it would respond to a prompt of 1956 Life Magazine ad, as in this thread. https://t.co/AQCQpFd0YS
@jholbo1 Or at least more rebates to drivers.
@swordsjew “An so on, infinitum.”
@jamesdnicoll Can’t believe nobody has trademarked Thitolomine as the name of an app or something.

@JohnQuiggin What scares me is I believe the Republicans in Congress generally aren’t smart and honest enough to properly supervise the Pentagon and its budget, and the Democrats are pathologically scared of Republican criticism.
@JohnQuiggin And both parties are funded by corrupt defense contractors. So while the culture of the US military is less corrupt than that of the Russians, I doubt the civilian leadership is doing a better job preventing corruption.

@trekonomics The Vatican didn’t get behind democracy until the 1890s or so, right? So really the same time lag as today’s integrationists and Vatican II.
@trekonomics Speaking of the Vatican, this just in: https://t.co/Tneyidd377

@trekonomics Is that what Levinas was playing with when he asserted that the Other imposes infinite responsibility — which the Talmud ameliorates to a manageable level?
@trekonomics (The Yeshiva University philosophy department in 1985 was absolutely not on the cutting edge. On the other hand, the rabbis who taught in the program at least opposed the religious Zionist terrorists of that era, who the Talmud faculty generally supported.)
@trekonomics Is that “Feudal capitalism” different than the beliefs of billionaire-friendly Democrats such as Pelosi and Clinton and Obama?
@AD_Lobel Pretty clear that it can’t be sung post-Brexit. At least without a fair amount of paperwork to reach mile 500.
@terrelljstarr Have a happy! https://t.co/upKEKK7Nho
How Newt Gingrich armed Americans and murdered its kids to help the Republican party. https://t.co/K7Lx4AwXLa
@BradArtson Yes. Not to be confused with the two Akiva’s I follow here. Or the one who, amazingly enough, is creating the new Star Trek series!
@allshiny Well, next time please inquire.
@allshiny Also, it’s a great world of multiculturalism when we can hear a Yiddish word like shtick used to introduce discussions of Mormon swinger drama.
Note to self: Keep this question in your pocket for use when necessary. https://t.co/nnuBj4GrV4
Your occasional reminder: Even inanimate objects are allowed accounts on this site. Which makes you really wonder about the moral character of former presidents who aren’t. https://t.co/FuWAOALKgO
And @bogiperson once again finds three very apt excerpts from @BenYehudaPress to help meditate on this difficult parsha at the end of what has been a very difficult week. https://t.co/FoOSzbjC24
@allshiny Wait. What? And is there a North Jersey (aka Teaneck) angle?
Some Torah principles for thinking about gun control. https://t.co/e3jybJeZZd
@scalzi Sugar would have more moral authority judging from a church lectern. Just saying.

@DylanRevisited It’s funny, because the case has been made that the assassination is was enabled the Civil Rights bills to be passed the following year.
@DylanRevisited Of course, seeing in 1965 that his political judgement had been wrong two years earlier would be even more reason to step away from politics. Which is what he did.
@jnack @okaysamurai What if you prompt it, “this, but each cat in a slightly different position”?
